content.rendered:
Dotted with several beautiful heritage sites, mesmerizing beauty, and an incomparable culture, Nepal offers its visitors some of the most memorable experiences. Nestled comfortably among the lush green valley and the stunning snowcapped mountains the entire land of Nepal is engulfed in extreme serenity and unparalleled wonderment. Nepal also serves as the base camp for the famous Everest base camp trek and the Annapurna circuit, two of the most enthralling tourist options for people who have hills on their minds. For people who are looking to spend some time away from the ever-increasing madness of the technological and digital age, availing a Nepal tour package is something you need to unwind, relax and let your hair down. Nepal is known for being every mountaineer and trekker’s ultimate delight, every devotee’s prime pilgrimage spot and every nature lover’s dream come true.

Our Nepal tour packages will take you across some of the most popular and spiritual tourist attractions which will be a whimsical blend of both historically majestic and spiritually drenched tourist spots. Offer your prayers to one of the prime Jyotirlingas in the subcontinent at Pashupatinath Mandir, walk the narrow local lanes of Thamel, re-live the times of kings at Durbar square, and visit the birthplace of the ‘enlightened one’, Lord Buddha at Lumbini. Our packages make sure that you get the best taste of this wonderful country which has something to offer to each of its visitors. This is the best place to visit if you are planning on a visit to Nepal with your family, friends, or loved ones. Discover the rich traditions, culture, and vibrant state of mind this place offers with our carefully curated tour packages which will make you keep coming back for more.

FAQs for Nepal Tour Packages

Q. How Much Will Nepal Trip Cost?

A. The cost of a Nepal trip varies based on factors such as travel duration, accommodation preferences, and activities. A budget trip might start around ₹ 41,550, while a more comfortable experience could range from ₹ 66,480 to ₹ 1,24,650 or more per person. This estimation excludes international transportation to Nepal.

Q. How Much Does A 7-Day Trip To Nepal Cost?

A. A 7-day trip to Nepal could cost around ₹ 49,860 to ₹ 83,100 per person, on average. This estimate includes accommodation, food, local transportation, and basic sightseeing. However, the total cost can vary depending on your travel style, chosen activities, and accommodation preferences during your week-long stay.

Q. How To Travel To Nepal With A Low Budget?

A. To travel to Nepal on a low budget, consider staying in budget accommodations like guesthouses or hostels, using local buses and shared transportation, eating at local eateries, and prioritizing free or low-cost attractions. Plan and book in advance, and explore destinations that offer affordable experiences, making the most of your budget.

Q. Which Month Is Best For Nepal Trip?

A. The best time for a Nepal trip is during the spring (March to May) and autumn (September to November) seasons. These months offer pleasant weather, clear skies, and excellent trekking conditions. Spring brings blooming flowers, while autumn showcases lush landscapes and is considered the peak trekking season in Nepal.

Q. Is Nepal A Cheap Place To Visit?

A. Yes, Nepal is generally considered a budget-friendly travel destination. Accommodation, food, and transportation are affordable compared to many other countries. Travellers can explore stunning landscapes, cultural sites, and outdoor activities without breaking the bank, making Nepal an attractive option for budget-conscious adventurers.
